alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 23 at 11:07AM EDT until May 24 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Edwardsport. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Petersburg and at Hazleton. .Recent rainfall across central Indiana has resulted in minor flooding along the White River. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins to flood several Pike County roads. Many of the following county roads begin to flood around this level...east of SR 57 include CR 750N...CR 600N and CR 1000E. Pike county road subject to flooding west of SR 57 include...CR 250 W...CR 400W...CR 675N...CR 700 N...CR 1000w...CR 900W...CR 700W and CR 775W. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Monday /9:30 AM CDT Monday/ the stage was 17.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EDT Monday /9:30 AM CDT Monday/ was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
